a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "x = (2 * pi) / 15"
and h1 : "cos x * cos (2 * x) * cos (4 * x) * cos (8 * x) = 1 / 16"
shows  "cos x * cos (2 * x) * cos (4 * x) * cos (8 * x) = 1 / 16"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify
\[\cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right).\] The final Answer is \frac{1}{16}
 ### Proof
 Let $x = \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right).$  Then by repeated application of the double angle formula, \begin{align}
 x \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) &= \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
 &= \frac{1}{2} \sin \left( \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\ &= \frac{1}{4} \sin \left (\frac {8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
 &= \frac{1}{8} \sin \left( \frac{16 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\ &= \frac{1}{16} \sin \left( \frac{32 \pi}{15} \right) \\ &= \frac{1}{16} \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right), \end{align}so $x = \boxed{\frac{1}{16}}.$
 *)

 x \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) &= \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
 &= \frac{1}{2} \sin \left( \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\ &= \frac{1}{4} \sin \left (\frac {8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
 &= \frac{1}{8} \sin \left( \frac{16 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\ &= \frac{1}{16} \sin \left( \frac{32 \pi}{15} \right) \\ &= \frac{1}{16} \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right), \end{align}so $x = \boxed{\frac{1}{16}}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes cos :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. cos x = cos (2 * pi / 15) * cos (4 * pi / 15) * cos (8 * pi / 15) * cos (16 * pi / 15)"
shows  "cos x = 1 / 16"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Find the value of the cosine function $cos(x)$ if $cos(x)$ is equal to the product of $cos(\frac{2\pi}{15})$, $cos(\frac{4\pi}{15})$, $cos(\frac{8\pi}{15})$ and $cos(\frac{16\pi}{15})$. The final answer is $\frac{1}{16}$.
